title: Can I be arrested for theft if I have a bill of sale for a vehicle? - Quora
tags: Legal Issues and Law in Everyday Life

response.answer_text: Unless you have a title that was signed over to your name you likely are going to at least be detained until the police straighten the situation out. In general police are not going to care unless the vehicle has been reported stolen by someone, and if you happen to get pulled over randomly, no theft report and the officer asks you about it then the bill of sale will likely cover you for that type of situation. If someone did call it in stolen then you could end up with some issues you will have to resolve.

You wouldn’t be arrested for theft. You would be charged with receiving stolen property, so you don’t get off scot free. Always do a thorough investigation of the vehicle before handing over money. Make sure it’s on the up and up.
